page.title: 05Poultry Farming,Eggs
page.content: The Kinsbourne Poultry Farm has been at Bury End for 20 years.30,000 chickens are kept in cages in 7 sheds each containing 3000-6000 hens.Feeding is a push- button operation twice a day.24 tons of feed are consumed each week.There are 6 full-time employees and 6 part-time egg collectors.25,000 eggs are produced each day and graded and packed on site and sold to 150-200 small shops from Bedfordshire to north London.Large quantity of manure is a problem.It is removed from the sheds weekly.Much is spread on there own land and nearby arable fields. Production:Grade 1 >70 grms-8% Grade 2 >65 grms-15% Grade 3 >60 grms-27% Grade 4 >55 grms-25% Grades 5 to 7 <55 grms-25%
